rule: The output should not contain any punctuation or additional characters outside of the correct category label.
input: Breakthrough in AI could transform healthcare industry
validityText:
The input is a string, which is compliant with the requirement that the input must be a string. Next, I evaluate whether the input represents a news article or headline relevant to one of the categories specified in the input specification: World, Sports, Business, or Sci/Tech. The given input, "Breakthrough in AI could transform healthcare industry", can be categorized under both "Sci/Tech" due to its focus on AI (a technology field) and "Business" because it discusses an industry (healthcare) transformation. Hence, it is relevant to the specified categories. Lastly, the input is not empty, which is compliant with the specification that input should not be empty.

No violations are detected.
OK
